page.title: 03COSFORD BRIDGE PUMPING WORKS
page.content: This pumping station is now owned by the S.T.W.A. and is situated at the junction of Neachley and Albrighton Brooks.It was privately built in two halves to serve Wolverhampton Corpor- ation.The first half was built in 1857 and the remainder in 1889.It was steam driven originally but is now powered by electric. The pumping station is situated above a 100' thick layer of New Red Sandstone which holds the water acting as an aquifier.It is supplied by the two brooks and 45 springs.Boreholes 16' across and 155' deep have been sunk.Some 20 million gallons of water is taken every 24 hours from the river and boreholes and supplies nearly half of Wolverhamptons water requirements. Originally geologists thought that the water supply would never run dry but this is no longer the case.
